metadata.title: CVE-2014-9732 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The cabd_extract function in cabd.c in libmspack before 0.5 does notproperly maintain decompression callbacks in certain cases where an invalidfile follows a valid file, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a craftedCAB archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmspack0 - 0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

cabextract - 1.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libmspack package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
cabextract package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1').
